summary: The document is a part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It is an FBI record dated January 8, 1965, concerning surveillance and activities related to Mark Lane, a figure associated with discussions on Lee Harvey Oswald's innocence in the assassination of President Kennedy. The document mentions Lane's planned talk in Zurich, Switzerland, sponsored by a known Trotskyite, and includes communications between FBI branches regarding surveillance and information sharing.
key_findings: The document is classified as 'Secret' and was last reviewed on December 10, 1997.
It involves surveillance of Mark Lane, who was discussing Lee Harvey Oswald's innocence.
The FBI was informed about Lane's upcoming talk in Zurich, sponsored by a Trotskyite individual.
The document highlights inter-agency communication, specifically between the FBI and possibly the CIA, regarding surveillance activities.
